org.apache.felix.ipojo.handlers.providedservice

Class ProvidedService.PerInstanceStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.felix.ipojo.handlers.providedservice.CreationStrategy
      • org.apache.felix.ipojo.handlers.providedservice.ProvidedService.PerInstanceStrategy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InvocationHandler, IPOJOServiceFactory, ServiceFactory
    Enclosing class:
    ProvidedService

    private class ProvidedService.PerInstanceStrategy
extends CreationStrategy
implements IPOJOServiceFactory, InvocationHandler
    Service object creation policy creating a service object per asking iPOJO component instance. This creation policy follows the iPOJO Service Factory interaction pattern and does no support 'direct' invocation.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private Map m_instances
      Map [ComponentInstance->ServiceObject] storing created service objects.

    • Method Detail

      • invoke

        public Object invoke(Object arg0,
            Method arg1,
            Object[] arg2)
        A method is invoked on the proxy object. If the method is the IPOJOServiceFactory.getService(ComponentInstance) method, this method creates a service object if not already created for the asking component instance. If the method is IPOJOServiceFactory.ungetService(ComponentInstance, Object) the service object is unget (i.e. removed from the map and deleted). In all other cases, a UnsupportedOperationException is thrown as this policy requires to use the IPOJOServiceFactory interaction pattern.
        Specified by:
        invoke in interface InvocationHandler
        Parameters:
        arg0 - the proxy object
        arg1 - the called method
        arg2 - the arguments
        Returns:
        the service object attached to the asking instance for 'get', null for 'unget', a UnsupportedOperationException for all other methods.
        See Also:
        InvocationHandler.invoke(java.lang.Object, java.lang.reflect.Method, java.lang.Object[])

      • getService

        public Object getService(ComponentInstance instance)
        A service object is required. This policy returns a service object per asking instance.
        Specified by:
        getService in interface IPOJOServiceFactory
        Parameters:
        instance - the instance requiring the service object
        Returns:
        the service object for this instance
        See Also:
        IPOJOServiceFactory.getService(org.apache.felix.ipojo.ComponentInstance)

      • ungetService

        public void ungetService(ComponentInstance instance,
                Object svcObject)
        A service object is unget. The service object is removed from the map and deleted.
        Specified by:
        ungetService in interface IPOJOServiceFactory
        Parameters:
        instance - the instance releasing the service
        svcObject - the service object
        See Also:
        IPOJOServiceFactory.ungetService(org.apache.felix.ipojo.ComponentInstance, java.lang.Object)

      • onUnpublication

        public void onUnpublication()
        The service is going to be unregistered. The instance map is cleared. Created object are disposed.
        Specified by:
        onUnpublication in class CreationStrategy
        See Also:
        CreationStrategy.onUnpublication()

      • ungetService

        public void ungetService(Bundle arg0,
                ServiceRegistration arg1,
                Object arg2)
        OSGi Service factory unget method. Does nothing.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        arg0 - the asking bundle
        arg1 - the service registration
        arg2 - the service object created for this bundle.

      • getSpecificationsWithIPOJOServiceFactory

        Utility method returning the class array of provided service specification and the IPOJOServiceFactory interface.
